message: Hey all -- Joey is the guest on tomorrow's show. Any of you Earbits -- if so, what do you think of the product?
I think @joeyjflores is one to watch
They're building something pretty great with Earbits IMO
@kirinkalia We both did Y Combinator at the same time, and I've discovered some cool electronic artists that I like which I haven't found on any other service.
How do you know Joey? And what kind of music have you discovered there?
e.g. Zilla...I'd never heard of them but they're a good band. Earbits suggested them, and boom, I'm hooked :)
Nice! have you recommended the service to friends? their feedback?
And how does that work at YC -- are you obligated to use each other's products?
Should also mention that Annmarie Cullen of SaucyMonky (an Earbits client) is also on the show. Annmarie wrote a song just for TWIST!

@kirinkalia We all tend to try each other's products out, but there's no obligation to use it.  It actually forces us to try harder because we know we have to make a good product for people to keep using it :)
Whattup everybody!  Looking forward to your feedback about tomorrow's show and please let me know if you have any comments about Earbits.
Hi all, thanks for joining the discussion here!
@ericflo for sure. I wonder if people can still play using the software they provide.
yes
Guess the show isn't Live... what about questions?
Well in this case, this customer seems more like a plug lol... but I think it's smart :).
@Mpressme Jason definitely enjoyed asking Annmarie about the way tech is changing an artist's approach to the business of music

I would have liked to try the site out prior to the interview, and we could give our feedback/user experience before the show started and therefor Jason can address some of his users feedback and questions with the business founders
@Mpressme Gotcha -- happy to do that, and it's easy enough to set up a survey in Survey Monkey
Annmarie wrote an original song for Jason...she sings it a little later!
@TWiST_Fanboy Yeah, seems like something right up his alley
fulltiltpoker.com pokerstars.com ultimatebet.com domains are starting to get seized by the FBI today. I wonder what @jason thinks about this.
@paisano you mean "Friday"?
TwitterPRO allows unlimited tweets
@Mpressme, we are not live, but Joey will check out this chat and answer questions
glee is doing that song next
twitter should charge per tweet. might reduce all the dumb tweets about loving pickles
yo Joey- nice work, dude!
Hey I missed the first half of the ep, I'm curious if they've talked about profitability and how they're making money
How long has it been since being through the program?
hello
@paisano Welcome!
hope the girl makes money from all this
Does anyone care that artists pay Earbits to have their music played?
@paisano pay to tweet...don't think that's a business model they're considering but could be interesting...might work if you're guaranteed a certain number of followers up front.
What do you think of having a customer alongside the CEO -- would you like to see more interviews like this?
@Mpressme Thanks!!
Q: Are you allowed to combine genres? Like on Pandora I'm able to select multiple genres and artists and get a diverse playlist.
We're getting there.
Not yet.
We had a batch-mate of Joey's on in February...Leah of Convore!
(for those who didn't watch live?)
Great!
but we can definitely encourage them to get in on the conversation here
I don't like the concept. it reminds me of DEMO charging startups to present
What do you think of Spotify's move to reduce number of free plays?
Very cool, any previous projects you've done?
Prior to earbits
They don't pay that much per song...
I actually really liked Earbits, helped me discover new artsits
@Mpressme Very true! I know people started trying out RedBeacon after we had Ethan Anderson on the show
Q: Mobile app?
As Joey just said, they only charge if the listener continues past the 30-sec mark
yeah! count me in. beside the business would have an easy 100+ new users just from us testing it.. ;)
I don't see that on the site ;(
I will search the app store
That's the big benefit for users of having the bands pay...no ads, and we can make it all about the bands.

Earbits... I think the platform that you guys have created is AWESOME!! Is there a mobile app for this? I listen to Pandora 90% of the time on my iPhone... this would be a great competitor for indie music!!!
@Mpressme Earbits is doing more than indie artists -- working with 95 labels. They're aiming big.
Haha!
You mentioned topspin. What's the connection? I know Ian. Love what they do
Earbits was part of YC?
Yeah that's really cool
Yes.
LMB
I'm here.  Will answer questions in just a moment.  Unfortunately, trapped on the phone!
How much do we pay to ask a question? Just kidding Joey!
@joef Thanks.
@victorau Do you mean us?
For Earbits
Oh very interesting
They'll bid $0.01 per play and be able to geo-target, etc.
@Mpressme interesting point. We tweet the guest a few hours ahead of time -- is there another way to reach you?
FYI, Tuesday's guest is Jay Rogers, CEO of Local Motors. He's bringing a Rally Fighter car, too!
I got the tweet... but it didn't really suggest that my feedback before hand was welcome... maybe letting us (the viewers) know.. maybe even vote... would be cool ;)
Welcome, Joey!
Hi Joey! I love the platform... as an artist and as a web developer!
Great for us!
We have iPhone and Android
Bands will buy airtime to promote specific shows, new releases and so on.
lowermybills?
Absolutely...everything we build we ask ourselves, how can this be awesome for both listeners and artists.
the interface is hot... clean and yet "in your face"
great show... I'll keep my eye on earbits.com... best of luck Joey!
For sure.  Thanks for having us.  Yep, I am a fan of Convore.  ;)
I do like the interface, its much better than pandora
It's easier to use and much more informative about the artists
When you pitched did you have an MVP?
Yeah, it's pretty cool that you took the time to come here while your episode was airing.
Yes.
Yeah, it's a great program.
I have a long background in internet marketing; started at a lead generation network, we got acquired, then I managed about $60M in marketing for the parent company.
yeah, that would be harder -- they need to stay focused on Jason's questions!
Oh very cool
also managed Justin Bieber?
Would be great to have the guests in for the live episodes too
We'll have more info on Joey and Earbits on the episode page at thisweekin.com
joking.. but it's important to have that music experience when your trying to launch anything music releated
Thanks for being here, Joey -- so great that you could answer questions directly
Yes, but it wasn't nearly as nice as the site is now.
And Joey was in a band -- so he knows what it's like to be an artist from that side too
We got out just about 3 weeks ago.
he looks familiar ;)
Thanks!
Will you be willing to check back in if there are more questions?
That is true, maybe Tyler needs to get in on the chat again
Looking for early adopters. Sign up to get notified upon launch and please like our page: http://igobubble.com
